contentrichtext.text: '''Raphah''' - tall - is a name in the [[Bible]]. It is used at least four times: # 2 Samuel 21:16 - "and Ishbi-benob tried to kill David.-He was a descendant of the Raphah(f);" (The Jewish Publication Society Hebrew/English Tanakh, 1999 No. 5759). Footnote f ("Apparently a race of giants") # 1 Chr. 8:2, 37 - A [[Benjamite]], the son of Binea, a descendant of [[Saul the King|Saul]]. # 1 Chr. 20:4, 6 - In a margin-note, where "giant" is given in the text. # Psalm 42:6 - a Hebrew word meaning to sink, relax, sink down, let drop, be disheartened (Strong Corcondance Entry No.7503) [[Category:Hebrew Bible people]] {{Hebrew-Bible-stub}}
